headline: Dry as a bone, here
text: So England is not the green and pleasant land it once was (Wildlife and farming disaster warning as drought spreads across England, 16 April). We had about five years of drought in Sydney, dam levels to 23% and a rigorous ban on using hosepipes and sprinklers. The good part was how little you really need to survive. No washing of cars, no watering of driveways, and sharing showers or baths. If your lawn was green, everyone knew you were using too much water. If you want to water your garden more often, reuse laundry water and buy water tanks for the next rains. Welcome to climate change. Robert PallisterPunchbowl, New South Wales, Australia  What's going wrong with climate change? In Scotland, we're getting April showers  in April.Bransby ClarkeMoffat, Dumfries and Galloway
